title-group.article-title: Stability of Runge-Kutta Methods for Quasilinear Parabolic Problems

abstract.p: We consider a quasilinear parabolic problem <tex-math>$u'(t) = Q(u(t))u(t), \qquad u(t_0) = u_0 \in D,$</tex-math> where <tex-math>$Q(w): D \subset X \rightarrow X, w \in W \subset X$</tex-math>, is a family of sectorial operators in a Banach space X with fixed domain D. This problem is discretized in time by means of a strongly A(θ)-stable, <latex>$0 < \theta \leq \pi/2$</latex>, Runge-Kutta method. We prove that the resulting discretization is stable, under some natural assumptions on the dependence of Q(w) with respect to w. Our results are useful for studying in L<sup>p</sup> norms, 1 ≤ p ≤ + ∞, many problems arising in applications. Some auxiliary results for time-dependent parabolic problems are also provided.
